definition: copper (chemistry)/see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: The structures of chiral quartz and copper helices are analysized.
sentences.chinese: 对手征性石英和螺旋铜丝的结构进行了分析研究。

sentences.english: The dried grass stood up sharply as if cooper teels.
sentences.chinese: 枯草支支直立，有如铜丝。

sentences.english: The thesis makes some theoretical research on fusing of opper wire.
sentences.chinese: 文章对铜丝通电熔化熔断进行了理论上的一些研究。

sentences.english: The temperature sensing element type WZC copper resistance is a wire winding.
sentences.chinese: 型铜电阻的感温元件是一个铜丝绕组。

sentences.english: The cavity and core were trepanned with frame electrode made of copper wire by EDM.
sentences.chinese: 使用紫铜丝制作线框电极，采用电火花腐蚀方法，以。

sentences.english: Point gluing together with copper wire fastening may be applied to interior walls.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙面可采用结构胶点粘结合铜丝绑扎工艺。

sentences.english: The checks in the waistcoat are but the wires of the cage .
sentences.chinese: 背心上的方格子不过是笼子上的铜丝而已。

sentences.english: Such a plain vase needs 500-meter-long copper wires.
sentences.chinese: 这样一个简单的花瓶就需要500米的铜丝。

sentences.english: If we take our copper wire, we know what y is.
sentences.chinese: 如果是铜丝，我们知道y的大小。
